item.title: The Prince Of Persia: Sands Of Time Remake Will Launch By March 2026, Ubisoft Says
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gamespot.com/articles/the-prince-of-persia-sands-of-time-remake-will-launch-by-march-2026-ubisoft-says/1100-6531547/?ftag=CAD-01-10abi2f

GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

Ubisoft has finally given word on a release window for the Prince of Persia: The Sands of Time remake, stating that the game will launch by the end of March 2026.

In its earnings call today, Ubisoft revealed that it plans for the Sands of Time remake to drop in fiscal year 2025-26, which officially ends on March 31, 2026. This significantly narrows down the release timeline for the game, as previously the publisher had only said it was coming in 2026.

Want us to remember this setting for all your devices?

Sign up or Sign in now!

Please use a html5 video capable browser to watch videos.

This video has an invalid file format.

Sorry, but you can't access this content!

Now Playing: Prince of Persia The Sands of Time - Teaser Trailer | Ubisoft Forward

This release window would mark nearly six years since the announcement of the game. Ubisoft originally teased the Sands of Time remake way back in 2020 for last-gen consoles. Since then, it has had a rocky development process, switching developers a few years ago following fan backlash to the original trailer and a missed launch date. It's probably safe to say at this point that the remake, now in the works at Ubisoft Montreal, will come to current-gen consoles.

In guidance to investors, Ubisoft is positioning the remake as part of a FY2025-26 lineup that is meant to stabilize the company's finances. In addition to the remake, its upcoming slate includes Anno 117, The Division Resurgence, and Rainbow Six Mobile. However, the publisher also announced that it is delaying multiple titles out of the current fiscal year and will have to continue cost-cutting measures in the near future.

This comes on the heels of a long stretch of bad news for the company, including several rounds of layoffs, studio closures, and decreasing profits. Ubisoft recently announced a corporate restructuring meant to consolidate efforts on its tentpole franchises Assassin's Creed, Rainbow Six, and Far Cry, and to integrate a large new investment from Tencent.

item.title: New Iron Man Game - Concept Art, Platforms, Battlefield 6 Connection, And Everything Else We Know
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gamespot.com/articles/iron-man-release-date-trailer-story/1100-6531545/?ftag=CAD-01-10abi2f

GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

Electronic Arts is teamed up with Marvel for multiple games, one of which is a new Iron Man game from Motive Studio in Montreal. It's still relatively early days for the project, but we've already learned a fair amount about the game. We're collecting everything we know about EA's Iron Man here in this post.

The new Iron Man game will join a small group of dedicated Iron Man titles that have come out over the years. Many years ago, Sega released game tie-ins for the first two Iron Man movies starring Robert Downey Jr., with Gameloft releasing a mobile game inspired by the movie Iron Man 3.

But now, Iron Man is set to take center stage once again with a new game from the developers of the Dead Space remake and Battlefield 6's campaign. Read on to learn everything we know about it so far.

Table of Contents [hide]

  • When will Iron Man released?
  • What kind of game is the new Iron Man?
  • Preorder Iron Man
  • Iron Man trailer information
  • Iron Man platforms
  • Iron Man story, setting, and characters
  • Iron Man game engine
  • Who's developing Iron Man
  • Other Marvel games in development
  • EA moving away from some licensed IP

When will Iron Man released?

The new Iron Man game has no confirmed release date, projected release window, or fiscal year on EA's release calendar. It was announced in September 2022, at which time many commented that EA may have announced the game early in its development cycle as part of the popular practice of revealing games early to help with recruitment. In September 2022, EA said the game was in the pre-production phase.

What kind of game is the new Iron Man?

The new Iron Man game is a single-player, third-person action-adventure game. EA has not released any footage, though, so we don't know what it looks like in action. It's not a stretch to imagine, though, that players will get to zip around in Iron Man's iconic powerful and protective armor.

EA has six open positions at Motive Studio available for the game, but none of them reveal much in the way of specifics. For example, a senior environment artist job ad seeks a candidate with experience making "immersive environments in AAA games." The person should be able to understand "what makes a game level fun and intriguing," but of course, this could apply to any game. Another ad, for a game designer, seeks a candidate who will "design and implement enemy AI that deliver an exciting and authentic Iron Man combat gameplay experience." Yet another ad, for a level designer, seeks a candidate to create "extremely fun, satisfying game levels that align with our creative vision."

Preorder Iron Man

Preorders for Iron Man are not yet available, so be careful out there with any site or platform offering to take your money to reserve a copy of the game.

Iron Man trailer information

There is no trailer yet for the new Iron Man game, nor is there any word on when one might arrive. The summer season is known for big gaming reveals, but as of yet, EA has not indicated that it will have anything to share about the new Iron Man game anytime soon.

Iron Man platforms

The new Iron Man game has no specific confirmed platforms, but EA confirmed its three upcoming Marvel titles will be released across console and PC.

Iron Man story, setting, and characters

EA has not published the official plot description for the Iron Man game, but the company has said it will tell an "original narrative" that channels the "complexity, charisma, and creative genius of Tony Stark." EA said its ambition with the project is to enable players to "feel what it's like to truly play as Iron Man." Given the game is set in the Marvel universe, it's expected other Marvel characters will appear as well.

Marvel boss Bill Rosemann said the game aims to be a "love letter to a legendary hero."

Iron Man game engine

A game ending for the Iron Man game is not confirmed, but open job listings for the project, like this one, call for people with familiarity with "advanced game engines" like the newest editions of Unreal and Unity. A different job ad, though, specifically mentions Unreal Engine 5.

Who's developing Iron Man

Motive Studio is developing the new Iron Man game. Based in Montreal, the studio released the Dead Space remake in 2023 and is also working on the campaign for Battlefield 6.

The game's executive producer is Olivier Proulx, who previously worked on Marvel's Guardians of the Galaxy game for Square Enix. Other developers working on Iron Man include Ian Frazier (Star Wars: Squadrons senior creative director), Maëlenn Lumineau (Assassin's Creed Odyssey production director), and JF Poirier (Star Wars: Battlefront II senior producer).

Other Marvel games in development

When EA announced the new Iron Man in 2022, it said it was the first of "several new games" as part of the deal between EA and Marvel. In 2023, EA announced a Black Panther game, with Cliffhanger Games attached to produce the title. EA's deal with Marvel spans at least three games, so there is one more to be announced for the current slate.

EA moving away from some licensed IP

In 2024, as part of EA's announcement that it was laying off nearly 700 people, the company said it would be "moving away from development of future licensed IP that we do not believe will be successful in our changing industry." The company did not release any specifics about what potential future licensed projects might not move ahead, or if any of the Marvel projects might be impacted.

Given the total silence from EA about its Iron Man, Black Panther, and third Marvel game in the works, some fans and industry observers have expressed fear that not all of these projects may go forward. As of yet, however, there is no reason to believe anything has changed with regards to Marvel's upcoming licensed IP slate.

With licensed IP, a company like EA is required to pay the license holder a fee. According to a report, the license fee with Disney for a third entry in the new Star Wars Battlefront series was part of the reason why the company apparently rejected DICE's pitch.

We don't know the specific terms of EA's deal with Marvel for its upcoming three-game slate, so it's unknown what kind of royalty rate or other business particulars may be in place.

Keep checking back with GameSpot for all the latest news on EA's upcoming Iron Man game.

Got a news tip or want to contact us directly? Email news@gamespot.com

item.title: 3D Platformer Nikoderiko: The Magical World Getting Physical Director's Cut And Collector's Edition Releases
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gamespot.com/articles/3d-platformer-nikoderiko-the-magical-world-getting-physical-directors-cut-and-collectors-edition-releases/1100-6531543/?ftag=CAD-01-10abi2f

GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

Released digitally for consoles and PC in 2024, the 3D platformer Nikoderiko: The Magical World is finally getting a physical release with Nikoderiko: The Magical World - Director’s Cut arriving on August 22. The Director's Cut edition will add a slew of new content to the colorful 3D platformer along with upgraded visuals and new music by famed composer David Wise. Preorders for the physical PS5, Switch, and Xbox versions are now available for $35, and you’ll even find a $50 Collector’s Edition filled with collectible goodies.

Nikoderiko: The Magical World - Director’s Cut

$35 | August 22

Nikoderiko: The Magical World is billed as “a love letter to platformers” that sees players bounding across colorful worlds filled with 3D platforming challenges, quirky characters, and challenging boss battles. The new Director’s Cut edition expanding the game with a new world to explore, a new Hard Mode difficulty, and new music from composer David Wise--best known for his work on the Donkey Kong Country series. Along with the new content, the Director's cut also sports enhanced visuals and additional voiceover languages. If you played the original, you can transfer your data to the Director’s Cut--ensuring you won’t have to replay through content you’ve already completed. Preorders are available on PS5, Switch, and Xbox.

item.title: Save 75% On NordVPN Plans And Get Free eSIM Service As A Bonus
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gamespot.com/articles/save-75-on-nordvpn-plans-and-get-free-esim-service-as-a-bonus/1100-6531536/?ftag=CAD-01-10abi2f

GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

The popular VPN service NordVPN is discounting select subscription plans by up to 75% until June 2. Even better, these discounted plans come bundled with a free Saily eSIM, which lets you travel internationally and use your phone without succumbing to hefty roaming fees. Whether you’re seeking added privacy, want to access your Netflix shows while abroad, or plan on traveling to other countries this summer, it’s definitely worth a closer look.

All four of NordVPN's 2-year plans--Basic, Plus, Complete, and Prime--are eligible for the deal, though the biggest discount is for Prime. A 2-year Prime membership is now just $177.36 (was $743.76), so if you want some serious privacy while online, it’s an easy recommendation. This plan includes support for 10 devices simultaneously, anti-malware protection, an ad blocker, a password manager, and 1TB of cloud storage. It also comes with identity theft insurance and cyber extortion insurance, among several other smaller perks.

Prime is the most comprehensive NordVPN plan, but the three others are also on sale. Each one offers a less-exhaustive list of features than the next, though they all get you secure access to a great VPN network. Here’s a look at the current discounts.

NordVPN 2-Year Deals

  • Basic -- $81.36 ($278.16)
  • Plus -- $105.36 ($359.76)
  • Complete -- $129.36 ($438.96)
  • Prime -- $177.36 ($743.76)

The second part of this promotion is access to Saily, as you'll get a digital coupon emailed to your account within 48 hours of purchasing an eligible NordVPN plan. The eSIM works with your smartphone to prevent roaming charges, allowing you to continue using your phone while traveling internationally, with support for over 200 countries. Depending on which NordVPN plan you purchase, you’ll unlock a different Saily service.

  • Basic -- 1GB eSIM data
  • Plus -- 5GB eSIM data
  • Complete -- 10GB eSIM data
  • Prime -- 10GB eSIM data

The NordVPN x Saily deal is running until June 2. Give it a look while you can, as it’s a pretty enticing bundle--especially if you’re planning to travel outside the country in the near future.
